title: Rugby World Cup 2019: Owen Lane confirmed as Wales replacement for injured Josh Navidi
text:
Cardiff Blues wing Owen Lane has been called into Wales' World Cup squad as replacement for injured back-row forward Josh Navidi.

The 21-year-old made his Test debut during Wales' World Cup warm-up games, scoring a try against Ireland in Cardiff.

The Welsh Rugby Union confirmed that Lane is on his way to Japan, with Navidi sidelined for the remainder of the tournament due to a hamstring injury. Lane will arrive in Tokyo later on Tuesday.

Owen Lane has been called into Wales's World Cup squad in place of the injured Josh Navidi

SQUAD UPDATE: @cardiff_blues wing @owen_lane has been called up to Wales' 31-man #RWC2019 squad, replacing Josh Navidi.



Lane, who made his international debut earlier this year, will arrive in Japan later this afternoon. pic.twitter.com/KZ0uPiUEOj — Welsh Rugby Union 🏉 (@WelshRugbyUnion) October 22, 2019

Navidi, 28, saw his campaign come to an end after being taken off in the 28th minute of the 20-19 win against France in Oita last Sunday, and was ruled out of the tournament with a grade two tear.

Head coach Warren Gatland also wants cover for Jonathan Davies and Hadleigh Parkes who have knee and hand knocks - but both players should be fine for the semi-final against South Africa on Sunday.

Wales face semi-final opponents South Africa in Yokohama, where they will bid for a place in the showpiece final.

Should they progress, they will meet the victors of England versus New Zealand, which gets under way at 9am on Saturday.
description: Cardiff Blues wing Owen Lane has been called into Wales's World Cup squad as replacement for injured back-row forward Josh Navidi. Navidi will miss the rest of the tournament due to a hamstring injury.
